response.summary:
I’m a student of History and International Relationships at the University El Rosario in Bogotá, Colombia. I am interested in the research sector, especially in the region of Latin America. 

Being a teacher assistant at my home university for two consecutive semesters, reflects all my compromises and motivations in the academic background. 

Also as a volunteer in the global NGO AIESEC, I have had the chance to interact with people from all over the world, and that has allowed me to develop my leadership, teamwork, fast-learning, and adaptation skills, as well as opened my mind. As my theoretical and practical experiences have created a profound desire to explore the world and its different cultures, I envision a future career in cultural studies and diplomacy.
response.skills: Liderazgo, Relaciones internacionales, Cooperación internacional, Voluntariado, Social Listening, Investigation, Writing, Academic Writing, Film, Leadership, Team Building, Team Leadership, English, Spanish, Historical Research, General Investigations

profile_positions.description: I volunteered in the world largest NGO for youth. My main task during all this time was to be in charge of the International Relations Coordination in different areas of the committee. In charge of a team who implemented strategies to attract international cooperations with other Local Committes of Aiesec around the world.
profile_positions.title: Team Leader

profile_positions.description: Pasante de investigación en el área de Memoria Histórica.
profile_positions.title: Student Internship

profile_positions.description:
Assistant of the class “Modern Latin America”, directed by professor Sven Benjamin Schuster. 

Main activities: 
-Supporting the creation of experimental dynamics in order to explain the topics seen in class 
-Guiding the students of the seminar in case of problems 
-Facilitating the team building activities of the class
profile_positions.title: Teaching Assistant

profile_positions.description: The Think Tank was directed by professor Karen Natalia Cerón, professor of the Faculty of International, Political and Urban Studies at the Universidad del Rosario.
profile_positions.title: Research Student-Think Tank “Ciudadanía, Territorio y Transformación Social”

education.degree_name: International mobility-Course of Latin American Politics

company.name: AIESEC
company.description:
AIESEC develops leadership among youth aged 18 to 30 and contributes to strengthening the global employability market by providing an end-to-end international talent recruitment solution for Enterprises, NGOs, and Start-ups.

AIESEC is the world's largest youth-run organization developing the leadership potential of young people. Present in 120+ countries and territories across 2600 universities, we provide students and recent graduates with life-changing experiences to intern or volunteer abroad within partner organizations. 

We partner with organizations ranging from Fortune 500 to local enterprises in developing and sourcing their global talent needs across our network. Through our programs in universities, we provide organizations with access to a global network of young talent who have the capabilities to make a positive impact.

For the last seven decades, we have developed over one million leaders ranging from business, civil society, and world leaders, including one Nobel Peace Prize Laureate. 

Learn more about us at - http://partners.aiesec.org
